Hey everyone. How do i delegate a swipe gesture on a view to the parent view (which has a swipe listener) when this view needs to be clickable?

<@U0D0AFX1B>. I think you override onTouchEvent instead of onClickListener, if it is a click, call 
                    getParent().requestDisallowInterceptTouchEvent(true); and it wont count as a swipe, and call 
                    getParent().requestDisallowInterceptTouchEvent(false); if you want it to be interpreted as a swipe, might be a way to do it with touch delegates too.
Hey any1 here knows how I would write a file to sd card using Rx?

but that feels really sloppy. I want it to happen on a worker thread, and let me show a snackbar when it’s done.
So I’d prefer using:
```
.subscribeOn(<http://Schedulers.io|Schedulers.io>())
    .observeOn(AndroidSchedulers.mainThread())
```
<@U0K1ALDQE>:  I'm in a similar situation. right now that's the design I have for reading from sd card. Seems to be working fine
But like you said it probably could be done better

Creating a field variable?
```public Observer<TextViewTextChangeEvent> searchObserver = new Observer<TextViewTextChangeEvent>() { [...]```

Or using a getter?
``` public Observer<TextViewTextChangeEvent> getSearchObserver() {
        return new Observer<TextViewTextChangeEvent>() { [...]```

Hmm. Is it possible in Dagger 2 to have a singleton OkHttpClient at the Application level, then specify a scoped provider that clones the client and modifies it based on, for example, an authorization header?
So you want to have multiple authorization header?

<@U0ESBF4AV>: I want to have a UserScope that provides a client with a certain header, yes, but I also want to create that client from the app-wide singleton instance so that I can share the connection pool and other inner bits
Hmmm from what I know you can use the same instance and set header every request right?
<@U0542GLTE>: more or less asking if it’s possible to override providers for types in subcomponents
because I’ve been trying and can’t get it to work
Dagger 2 docs says “Dagger 2 doesn’t support `overrides`” in modules
Not too bad, I think I can achieve the same effect by moving the Retrofit creation to the subcomponent instead of trying to override creation of the OkHttpClient there
<@U0542GLTE>: yeah but I was trying to avoid qualifiers
Ahh. that was the only other option I could think of
just a shame scopes don’t support it natively
it’s generating the provider, but the subcomponent’s generated class is still using the parent component’s provider instead
<@U060Q7J2Y>: I’m inclined to agree with you sometimes
<@U060Q7J2Y>: I’m hoping for something better than Dagger 1/2, honestly
still too much boilerplate, even with Dagger 2
might even be something the build system should handle, rather than an annotation processor
<@U053LEHJN>: i would agree with that too
i was not very impressed with dagger 1
never wanted to try out dagger 2
<@U0JLWN2RH>: have to use Dagger 2 for work
what are you guys using it for mainly?
what everyone else is, I guess
D1 the only pain point is the injects list
D2, you need all these components
Retrofit and SharedPrefs and good, anything you want to be able to swap for testing, etc
<@U060Q7J2Y>: I still don’t see why the build system couldn’t handle all of that
well, the specialization for tests, too
gradle is almost there with source sets and build flavors
you dont need dagger if you want that
its just a good way to do architecture

Quick Question. Does anyone have any intelligent way to make the client(android) send to the server the location from pointA to pointB without initializing the event?. Is there any ways to do it automatic on android? or will the user need to lets say drop a pin to the location A and B?
<@U0DVBPZR8> do you have the addresses of location a and b?
you can send them to google maps and get that information
but you need to know the coordinates
technically on the server it could be done if android sent the 2 points
I have all the addresses of the locations
on the server it can be figured out
I am handling the server side
but id like to know if the client can initialize this action with the user saying ok here is my starting point, and here now is my ending pooint
Id like to initialize a pick up and a drop off
but i dont want to make the user say ok im picking it up now
or let me click this button which will let me know thats their pickup location
you would have to trigger it with some event or action
unless i go all IoT on this shit and attach chips lol
<@U0JLWN2RH>: thanks for your suggestions man. rellly helpful
somehow the users has to tell you
yea thats what i was kind of afraid of
will need to think of a clever way to benefit the user then I guess so they can tell me
have them shake the phone like a soda can
I like where your going with this :simple_smile:
